intro: Oxycaryum piliferum, commonly known as the hairy oxycaryum, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit. The plant features long, narrow leaves covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in panicles, typical of many grass species. Oxycaryum piliferum is often found in wetland or marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
